channel.title: Comments on: Log Shipping for cheap DR
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Don Draper
item.dc:creator: Don Draper
item.content:encoded:
I am using manually created jobs for log-shipping across SQL 2000 database and they automatically perform full-backs (re-initialize) each weekend. With 2008 R2, the Initialize Secondary Database tab is missing once log-shipping is started.

So my question: How does one re-initialize log-shipping that gets our of sync in 2008? I assume you still have to perform a full-backup, copy and restore to the secondary server. Is there a way to do this within the automated jobs or SSMS or must this be done manually? Since the Initialize Secondary Database tab is missing, where do you go?

Great article…very helpful and indepth.
